job_description: Senior Policy Analyst - job post City of Seattle 207 reviews Seattle, WA $99,911 - $149,918 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $99,911 - $149,918 a year Job Type Full-time Position Description The Office of Inspector General for Public Safety (OIG) was established by Ordinance 125315 as part of the City of Seattle police accountability reform effort. Our charge is to help ensure the fairness and integrity of the police system in its delivery of law enforcement services. Our goal is to ensure constitutional, accountable, effective, and respectful policing that reflects the values of Seattle's diverse communities and engenders community trust. As required by ordinance and approved by the Federal Police Monitor, OIG is charged with post-Consent Decree oversight of Seattle Police Department (SPD)'s fidelity to Consent Decree reforms. In 2022, OIG began development of a monitoring assessment plan with the goal of ensuring delivery of police services in full compliance with the Constitution and laws of the United States, while prioritizing the needs of the Seattle community. To take on this new and critical work, OIG is seeking a Senior Policy Analyst who will lead a small team, providing project management and policy, statistical, and analytical expertise in the review of policies, procedures, and practices managed by SPD. This work will expand from the previous work by the Federal Monitor and the goals laid out by the Consent Decree. This team will ensure compliance with constitutional policing and identify trends within SPD to continue the commitment to reform. Our work environment is complex and highly scrutinized, as we play a critical role in police accountability for the City of Seattle. This work is relied upon by policy and lawmakers to make informed decisions that shape our city. This position serves at the discretion of the Inspector General. This position is currently under review for the classification title of Strategic Advisor 2, Exempt. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and life experiences. Pursuant to Ordinance 125315, applicants for positions with OIG must not have been employed by the Seattle Police Department as a sworn officer and must pass a criminal background check. YOU WILL BE MOST SUCCESSFUL IN THIS POSITION IF YOU: Have strong project management skills. Have knowledge and experience in criminal justice public policy and/or oversight of law enforcement. Have significant experience in evaluation of data and public policies. Have rigorous analytical skills and rely heavily on data to drive the analysis of public policy. Are proficient in statistical analysis, including research methods, modeling techniques, parametric and non-parametric hypothesis testing, statistical software, data-mining concepts, and analyzing geo-coded datasets for patterns and trends. Understand the importance of racial equity in the analysis and development of policies and programs to address institutional/systemic racism. Are an effective communicator and team leader who takes a proactive approach to building relationships with colleagues and stakeholders (law enforcement, community members, data scientists, and social justice advocates). Job Responsibilities Analyze data; evaluate policies, regulations, rules and procedures; develop recommendations. Prepare written reports including issue papers, decision agendas, presentation materials, and executive summaries. Support literature review and secondary analyses of research, theory, and practices relevant to criminal justice. Assist the leadership team and agency staff with the planning and development of work products, informed by knowledge and expertise in statistical analysis and methodology. Work as part of a team in conducting and supporting policy analysis that is informed by a review of the customs and practices of local and other law enforcement jurisdictions. Determine the adequacy and compliance of SPD internal controls, management practices, record keeping, and reporting. Effectively communicate work to internal and external audiences, including presentations for elected officials in Council committees and other public settings as well as in private briefings with elected officials and their staff. Qualifications A SUCCESSFUL APPLICANT WILL HAVE THESE SKILLS, ABILITIES, KNOWLEDGE, AND EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree in public administration, public policy, law, applied research, or other field related to criminal justice policy. 3+ years of progressively responsible experience managing projects, conducting policy analysis, data analytics, or applied statistics in a social science discipline (criminal justice, economics, demography, sociology, political science, applied mathematics, statistics) or related field. Ability to objectively analyze and derive insights from quantitative and qualitative datasets using advanced statistical software packages such as Stata or R. Clear writing and presentation skills, which include the ability to convey complex information and answer questions under pressure. Demonstrated skill and initiative in team leadership, teamwork, and team building. YOU MAY BE EVEN MORE PREPARED FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES: An advanced degree or additional experience in public administration, public policy, law, applied research, or other field related to criminal justice policy. Additional Information TOTAL COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS This full-time position is currently under review for the classification title of Strategic Advisor 2, Exempt. This role is exempt from the FLSA and the Civil Service System. The full salary range for this position is $99,910.80 - $149,918.40 per hour. The salary range for this individual role has been identified as $105,000 - $140,000 annually. The City of Seattle offers a comprehensive benefits package including vacation, holiday, and sick leave as well as medical, dental, vision, life and long-term disability insurance for employees and their dependents. More information about employee benefits is available on the City's website at: https://www.seattle.gov/human-resources/benefits/employees-and-covered-family-members/most-employees-plans WORK SCHEDULE Our office is abiding by public health guidelines and maximizing telework arrangements for our employees except for necessary essential in-person. The selected candidate will work with their direct supervisor on alternatives to meet workload requirements while considering public health guidelines. COMMITMENT TO SOCIAL JUSTICE The City of Seattle recognizes every City employee must play a role in ending institutional and structural racism. Our culture is the result of our behavior, our personal commitments, and the ways that we courageously share our perspectives and encourage others to do the same. To cultivate an antiracist culture, we seek employees who will engage in the Race and Social Justice Initiative by working to dismantle racist policies and procedures, unlearn the way things have always been done, and provide equitable processes and services. HOW TO APPLY Complete an online application and supplemental questionnaire. Attach a PDF cover letter. Attach a PDF resume. Attach a PDF writing sample that has not been significantly edited or contributed to by others that reflects your own work product and writing abilities. Applications received without the requested materials will not be considered. Job offers are contingent upon the verification of credentials and other information required by the employment process including the successful completion of a background check. The City of Seattle offers a comprehensive benefits package including vacation, holiday and sick leave as well as medical, dental, vision, life and long-term disability insurance for employees and their dependents.

Sr. IT Business Analyst (remote) - job post Weyerhaeuser 952 reviews Seattle, WA • Remote $101,600 - $152,400 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $101,600 - $152,400 a year Job Type Full-time Description At Weyerhaeuser, our IT team is on a mission to help make Weyerhaeuser the world’s premier timber, land and forest products company. We’re not just in the cloud, we’re implementing technology that keeps us at the forefront of innovation in our industry. We run a mix of commercial software and fully integrated, custom, cloud-native applications built on AWS and Microsoft Dynamics365 that support critical operations and a dynamic ecommerce business. If you want to be part of a world-class technology team changing the world we live in – come grow with us! Location: This position will have the flexibility to report out of Weyerhaeuser’s Seattle Headquarters, Weyerhaeuser’s Atlanta office or work remotely provided you are currently based (or plan to move to) one of the following states; Alabama, Arkansas, Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Louisiana, Maine, Michigan, Mississippi, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington or West Virginia. This role is not open to those who live in other states or countries. Description: We are looking for a talented Sr. IT Business Analyst who is highly motivated and team oriented who will deliver and support software applications using product management disciplines. You will be part of a passionate, fast-moving organization of IT professionals who partner with Weyerhaeuser’s Portfolio Analytics, Portfolio Management, Natural Resource and Natural Climate Solutions, Land Development and Recreation businesses to create sustainable competitive advantage. As a Sr. IT Business Analyst II on Weyerhaeuser’s Corporate Development IT team, your primary responsibility will be to gather and document requirements; design, test, implement, and support both process improvements and software application enhancements. You will also facilitate product, project and program planning and roadmap development. Roles and Responsibilities: Interface with Weyerhaeuser Corporate Development business employees to understand their business requirements, translate to technical requirements, and collaborate on detailed design with other IT teams. Design innovative processes and systems that meet business needs including improved productivity, efficiency, and effectiveness. In partnership with business stakeholders, create and manage software product backlogs with standard processes for evaluating return on investment, functional fit and feasibility. Document functional requirements for items in the backlog including detailed acceptance criteria; create UI/UX wireframes and work with developers on mockups, pilots, etc. Participate in the end-to-end success of projects from discovery to product launch. Work with business stakeholders and the Product Manager to understand, rank, and prioritize business needs to ensure each product release delivers maximum business value. Facilitate and coordinate CDO IT product, project and program planning and roadmap development. Develop and manage common processes and tools for CDO IT project planning, tracking and reporting status and budgets. Participate in agile/scrum sprint ceremonies including planning, standups, reviews, and retrospectives. Plan, create, document, and conduct system quality assurance testing and implementation activities, ensuring business requirements and functional specifications are implemented effectively and meet business objectives. Create user guides and deliver end user training. Coordinate and provide operational support for software products. Ensure that established quality expectations are met and incorporate functional and non-functional quality measures into requirements. Optimize usability and performance within cost constraints. Perform root cause analysis of system issues. Provide guidance to other IT Business Analysts. Qualifications Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Analysis or related field. Typically requires a minimum of seven (7) to ten (10) years of progressive, relevant information technology experience. Experience with or demonstrable knowledge of agile product management. Understanding of IT risks and controls. Ability to manage a diverse workload and with minimal supervision. Commitment to expand knowledge and skills, is coachable, and a fast learner with natural curiosity and a hunger for self-improvement. A team player who excels at building relationships and enjoys working both collaboratively and as an individual contributor. Strong oral and written communication skills including presentation of technical topics with non-technical audiences. A passionate and creative problem solver who loves to find innovative approaches to solve business problems. Technical Qualifications Experience configuring Microsoft Power Platform, including Dynamics 365 model-driven applications, Power Automate, and Power Apps. Fluency with product development operations software e.g., Azure DevOps or Jira Working knowledge of the software development lifecycle. Working knowledge of ITIL/ITSM principles and practices. Travel Occasional travel required (approximately 1-2 times per year). Compensation : This role is eligible for our annual merit-increase program, and we are targeting a salary range of $101,600 - $152,400 based on your level of skills, qualifications and experience. You will also be eligible for our Annual Incentive Program, which offers a cash bonus targeting 15% of base pay. Potential plan funding may range from zero to two times that target. Benefits : When you join our team, you and your family will be covered by our comprehensive health benefits plan, which includes medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. We also support personal volunteerism, sponsor a host of diversity networks, promote mentoring, and provide training and development opportunities to help you chart your path to a fulfilling career. Retirement : Employees may enroll in our company’s 401k plan, which includes a paid company match in addition to our annual contribution equal to 5% of your base salary. Paid Time Off or Vacation : We provide eligible employees who are scheduled to work 25 hours or more per week with paid vacation for up to 3 weeks to use during your first year of employment. In addition, after being employed for six months, eligible employees begin to accrue vacation for future use. We also recognize eleven paid holidays per year, providing a total of 88 hours along with paid parental leave for all full-time employees. Weyerhaeuser is an equal opportunity employer. Inclusion is one of our five core values and we strive to maintain a culture where all our people feel a sense of belonging, opportunity and shared purpose. We are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce and supporting an equitable and inclusive environment that inspires people of all backgrounds to join, stay and thrive with our team. Job Information Technology Primary Location USA-WA-Seattle Schedule Full-time Job Level Individual Contributor Job Type Experienced Shift Day (1st)

Sr. Market Research Analyst - job post Virtuoso, Ltd. 22 reviews 5050 1st Ave S, Seattle, WA 98134 $80,000 - $90,000 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $80,000 - $90,000 a year Job Type Full-time Virtuoso® is the leading global travel agency network specializing in luxury and experiential travel. This by-invitation-only organization comprises over 1,200 travel agency locations with 20,000 travel advisors in 50 countries throughout North America, Latin America, the Caribbean, Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa and the Middle East. Drawing upon its preferred relationships with more than 2,200 of the world’s best hotels and resorts, cruise lines, airlines, tour companies and premier destinations, the network provides its upscale clientele with exclusive amenities, rare experiences and privileged access. Normalized annual sales of (U.S.) $25-$30 billion make Virtuoso a powerhouse in the luxury travel industry. For more information, visit www.virtuoso.com. The Senior Market Research Analyst will be responsible for gathering and analyzing data on a specific area of the luxury travel industry, such as Cruise, Hotels, Customer Demographics, etc. and collaborating with teams across Virtuoso to provide insights that enhance decision making. The Senior Market Research Analyst will serve as an in-house subject matter expert on their assigned coverage area. Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Serve as Virtuoso’s subject matter expert for the analyst’s assigned coverage area. Research and compile data related to the analysts’ coverage area within the luxury travel industry. Collaborate with Business Intelligence Analysts to combine multiple data sources to discover novel insights. Analyze data to identify industry trends and potential opportunities for Virtuoso products. Make recommendations related to research findings. Create reports and deliver analysis to BI managers, other team leaders and/or executive leadership. Support executives and/or other Virtuoso staff with producing content for Events, press releases or other publications. Ability to work in a white space environment and be creative Educational and Skills Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in any Business-related field (Business Management, Marketing, Strategy, Finance, Economics, etc.) or applicable experience. Minimum of 2 years of in-depth experience working on research projects with broad scope. Knowledge of and/or experience within the travel industry Demonstrated existing knowledge and experience within the travel industry Demonstrated proficiency with market research methodology, analysis and reporting Effective communication skills Creative problem solving Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Prior experience with FactSet is a plus Detail Oriented – attention to data accuracy, completeness and relevancy Team Player – collaborate with other business units and coworkers Analytical – analyze data, detect patterns, provide creative solutions Self-Starter - Ability to work independently Collaboration – Strong skills in inspiring the win-win-win Marketplace Awareness – Current business trend knowledge Innovation – Forward thinking, curious, & creative Travel Requirements: Infrequent travel may be required to attend company events. (1-3 trips per year) Travel will be primarily domestic but may include some international. Type/Nature of Contacts: External: May include contact with partners or members. Internal: Key job contacts are primarily with managers outside of the job’s immediate work unit/department. We offer a competitive salary and full benefits package, including medical/dental/vision/life, 401(k) savings plan, and more. Virtuoso is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to promoting a diverse workforce.

L&I IT Business Analyst- Senior - job post State of Washington Dept. of Labor & Industries 330 reviews Tumwater, WA $84,072 - $113,064 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $84,072 - $113,064 a year Job Type Full-time Description Our Mission: Keep Washington Safe and Working! Our Values: Customer Focus, One L&I, Respect, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, Learning and Growth, Reliability Please note: This position will receive for 5% incentive for supervisory duties Are you an experienced Business Systems Analyst? Do you have experience in coaching and mentoring? Do you consider yourself accountable? Finally, do you tend to look at the big picture with a strategic mindset? If yes, this might be the perfect opportunity for you! The Information Technology (IT) Division is a service organization responsible for providing information technology-based products and services in support of the Department of Labor and Industries (L&I) agency business priorities so that L&I can keep Washington Safe and Working. The SIO aligns technology with customer needs by delivering the agency’s highest priority and time sensitive IT investments that are delivered agency-wide. The Strategic Investment Office (SIO) is responsible for aligning technology with customer needs by delivering the agency’s highest priority and time sensitive Information Technology (IT) investments. The Business Analyst- Senior provides business analysis consultation for changes to major organization-wide, high-risk/high-impact large-scale, mission-critical projects or enterprise systems. These projects often integrate new technology and/or carry out organization-wide information technology functions, or impact other institutions or agencies. This position provides business analysis leadership, technical proficiency with BA tools, and demonstrates advanced knowledge of business analysis practices, principles, and skills. This position supervises other Business Analysts. Duties Some of what you will do: Supervise Business Analysts, including: Staff Planning Develops staffing plans. Recruits, interviews, and hires staff. Supervising Manages staff leave (including FMLA and bereavement). Manages conflict resolution and mediation; facilitating issues that arise whether personnel or project related. Listens to staff concerns and coaches on solutions to their problems. Coordinate staff meetings, conducts one-on-one meetings; and shadows employees to determine performance. Writes and reviews Performance Planning and Appraisals; discussing and documenting performance or behavior issues. Has crucial conversations in order to hold staff accountable. Developing Teams/ Skills Involves employees in individual and team engagement exercises to building a cohesive team unit. Plans staff recognition and communicates with transparency to ensure staff are aware of current agency endeavors and events. Develops employee training and performance plans. Trains staff in tools, techniques, and standards for business analysis work. Coaches and mentors staff work; reviewing, editing, and providing feedback on project documentation. Coaches staff on how to resolve conflicts and negotiate for successful projects. Staffing Plans, Position Description Forms, DJA Contracts, maintained staff leave balances, Performance Planning and Appraisal Forms. IT Business Analysis Enterprise Strategy Analysis Analyzes Current State: Understands the business need and how it relates to the way the enterprise functions today Defines Future State: Defines goals and objectives that will demonstrate that the business need has been satisfied and defines what parts of the enterprise need to change in order to meet those goals and objectives. Assesses Risks: Understands the uncertainties around the change, considers the effect those uncertainties may have on the ability to deliver value through a change, and recommends actions to address risks where appropriate. Defines Change Strategy: Performs a gap analysis between current and future state, Risk assessment, gap analysis and Business Cases Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring Plans Business Analysis Approach: Defines appropriate method to perform business analysis, how and when to perform tasks, and for deciding the appropriate techniques and deliverables. Conducts Stakeholder Analysis: Identifies the initiative-affected stakeholders and those who share a common business need. Identifies appropriate stakeholders for the project or project phase, and determines stakeholder influence and/or authority regarding the approval of project deliverables. Plans Business Analysis Activities: Manages business analysis activities and deliverables, BA effort estimates, and identifies the management tools required to measure the progress of those activities and deliverables. Plans Business Analysis Communication: Describes the proposed structure and schedule for regarding business analysis activities Plans Requirements Management: Develops processes to elicit requirements approval Test Planning: Identifies tests to be performed, test participants, test environments, and schedules for test phases. Business Analysis Management Plan Business Analysis Deliverable Assessment Form Requirements Elicitation and Collaboration Conducts Elicitation Activities: Meets with various stakeholders to elicit information and understands their needs. Documents Elicitation Results: Records information provided by stakeholders for use and re-use in analysis. Confirms Elicitation Results: Communicates to and manages stakeholder collaboration and expectations. Validates that stated requirements match stakeholder understanding of the problems and stakeholder needs. Solution Requirements Specifications Document, and the Business Analysis Deliverable Assessment Form. Requirements Life Cycle Management Traces Requirements: Analyzes and maintains the relationships between requirements, designs, solution components, and other work products for enterprise-wide impact analysis, coverage, and resource allocation. Maintains Requirements: Ensures that requirements and designs are accurate and current throughout the life cycle and facilitate re-use where appropriate. Prioritizes Requirements: Assesses the value, urgency, and risks associated with particular requirements and designs Assesses Requirements Changes: Evaluates new and changing stakeholder requirements Approves Requirements: Works with stakeholders involved in the governance process to reach approval and agreement on requirements and designs. Traceability for requirements to maintain the relationships between requirements, designs, solution components, and other work products Requirements Analysis and Design Definition Specifies and Models Requirements: Describes a set of requirements or designs in detail using analytical techniques; including outlining design requirements for usable solutions Verifies Requirements: Ensures the development of a set of requirements or designs Validates Requirements: Ensures that a set of requirements or designs delivers business value and supports the organization's goals and objectives. Defines Requirements Architecture Analyzes Potential Value and Recommends Solutions: Assesses the business value associated with a potential solution Business Case, the Solutions Requirements Specifications document, and the Business Analysis Deliverable Assessment Form. Solution Evaluation Measures Solution Performance: Determines the most appropriate way to assess the performance of a solution, including how it aligns with enterprise goals and objectives, and completes the assessment. Analyzes Performance Measures: Examines information regarding the performance of a solution in order to understand the value it delivers to the enterprise and to stakeholders. Determines whether it meets business needs. Assesses Solution Limitations: Investigates issues within the scope of a solution that may prevent it from meeting business needs. Performance Measures Recommendation document and the Business Analysis Deliverable Assessment Form. Solution Testing, Training, and Transfer to Production Test Development: Develops test cases and scripts, identifies test data, and sets up multiple complex, interfacing test environments Test Execution: Mentors and guides stakeholders through user acceptance testing; using testing tools for tracking defects. Conducts enterprise-wide testing across multiple domain systems, including regression testing and re-testing corrected defects. Test Reporting: Reports defects to the development team and generates metrics for test efforts. Traces defects to requirements to ensure end-to-end solution quality and accuracy. Training: Delivers relevant and easy to understand solution instructions to business trainers. Organizational Change Management: Prepares, equips and supports individuals to successfully adopt change in order to drive organizational success and outcomes. Business Analysis Deliverables Checklist, the Business Analysis Deliverable Assessment Form. Qualifications Required: Minimum of 24 months direct experience supervising staff; including planning staff workload, performance evaluation, managing leave, and training. Minimum of 24 months direct experience in performing business analysis functions; including planning activities, elicitation, tracking and documentation of business requirements, development of use cases and management of testing processes. Expert in business analysis methodology and best practices. Successfully completed IIBA (International Institute of Business Analysis) classes for the above competencies can substitute for the years of experience. The ability to lead and work with teams and mentor staff. Advanced facilitation including effectively leading, presenting, and managing large groups, resolving conflict and achieving consensus from people with diverse interest. Proven experience in handling disagreements, dealing with difficult people, and using conflict resolution strategies. Previous experience working on technology projects in the role of business analyst, client lead or project manager. Preferred: Certified or professional level certification as a business analyst. Successful completion of certified International Institute of Business Analysis classes. Certification as a Lean consultant. Supplemental Information Things You Need To Know To help you maintain a proper work-life balance, teleworking is one of the work schedule options for this position. L&I also offers flexible custom work schedules. State employee who meet the qualifications will become eligible for a generous retirement package at the end of the employee’s career. Click on the “Benefits” tab to learn more. At L&I, your voice matters. In addition, L&I is a diverse state agency dedicated to the safety and health and security of Washington's 3.3 million workers. Take a look at this brief video and learn more about why L&I is an employer of choice. Per Governor Inslee’s Directive 22-13.1, state employees must be fully vaccinated effective November 4, 2022. Providing proof of being fully vaccinated is a condition of employment and your vaccine status will be verified by Human Resources prior to your first day of employment. Please contact Steve Camerer at cste235@lni.wa.gov if you need information on medical or religious accommodation. For this position, telework is full-time. The assigned duty station for this position is Tumwater, Washington. Application process We will contact the top candidates directly to interview for this position. Because we base the selection on information provided by you, it is in your best interest to identify the knowledge, skills, and abilities that address the mandatory and desirable qualifications described in the announcement. Please include the following documents with your application: A cover letter describing specific qualifications. A current resume detailing applicable experience and education. A list of at least three professional references with current telephone numbers. Please do not attach or place any information about your vaccination status, including listing the governor’s mandate as a reason for leaving employment, within the application, resume, or cover letter. If you do, we will have to reject your application to safeguard others from receiving your confidential information. You will have to remove the confidential information before you can apply again. Other information A job offer is contingent upon completion of a background check that includes a criminal record review. For positions requiring travel, you must have a valid unrestricted driver's license and have insurance if driving a privately owned vehicle on state business. This position is represented by the Washington Federation of State Employees (WFSE). Candidates who are offered a job with L&I must possess work authorization that does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa now or in the future. The Department of Labor & Industries complies with the employment eligibility verification requirements of the federal employment eligibility verification form, I-9. The selected candidate must be able to provide proof of identity and eligibility to work in the United States consistent with the requirements of that form on the first day of employment. Please note: L&I may use this announcement to fill multiple permanent and/or non-permanent positions. IT position applicants selected to move forward in this hiring process will receive an email skills assessment invitation within 3 weeks of your application being accepted. An applicant may complete the assessment when ready, but the invitation to complete the assessment will expire 5 days after the invitation was sent. Once you start the assessment, you will be required to complete it. You cannot start your assessment and then come back to it later. Please look in your email inbox or spam as these invitations are sent by CodeSignal. Did You Know? Washington is America's Top State to live, play, and work, according to U.S. News (2021). Join the L&I team and enjoy all the Evergreen State has to offer. In addition to offering a positive balance between life and work, L&I provides one of the most competitive benefits packages in the nation. We also believe your voice matters. We value our employees and their work-life balance by encouraging flexible schedules. L&I is a diverse state agency dedicated to the safety and health and security of Washington's 3 million workers. Veterans Preference Applicants wishing to claim Veterans Preference should attach to their application a copy of their DD-214 (Member 4 copy), NGB 22, or signed verification of service letter from the United States Department of Veterans Affairs. Please blackout any personally identifiable data such as Social Security numbers. For further information, contact L&I’s Jobs@lni.wa.gov. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Employer L&I employees come from all walks of life. We strive to hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We believe in the importance of recognizing the value each of us contribute to the success of the agency mission. Having a diverse workforce is this agency’s greatest resource of strength and knowledge. It is through the combination of talents and abilities that we can pursue finding effective measures to provide the best customer service. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone and we strongly mean everyone. The State of Washington is an equal opportunity employer. Persons with a disability who need accommodation in the application process or testing process, or those needing this announcement in an alternative format, may call 360-902-5700. CRM Business Analyst III - job post Umpqua Bank 342 reviews 1498 Pacific Avenue, Tacoma, WA 98402 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Essential Job Functions: Provides full lifecycle support for the Bank’s CRM system. Conducts product analysis, requirements gathering and business process analysis. Performs outreach to the user community to identify pain points and other opportunities for improvement. Facilitates meetings, develops and delivers presentations, creates process models, documents requirements, conducts workshops and training, surveys, and evaluates user feedback. Translates business logic into user interfaces for different business components of the application. Ensures that solutions support business processes and are aligned to meet the organization’s strategic business goals. Prepares accurate and detailed requirement specification documents, functional specification documents, training materials and user guides. Ensures that the technology objectives of the enterprise were aligned to the business goals, by phasing out previously built customizations and adopting the latest features and functionality offered by the cloud service vendor. Consistently and effectively communicates upcoming CRM changes and the progress of the initiatives to business users. Performs testing. Provides production support. All employees are responsible for internal controls in the performance of their assigned duties. Internal Control responsibilities are established in various policies, procedures, and documents, including the Code of Conduct. Minimum Job Requirements: 5+ years experience with CRM system implementation projects in the banking industry, specifically with Oracle CX, Salesforce, or Microsoft Dynamics. High School diploma. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business or related field preferred. 8 years of general project management experience, with an Agile approach, and utilizing Microsoft DevOps (Azure or VSTS). 7 years of experience in analysis and configuration of CRM systems. Experience documenting customer requirements and suggesting changes to optimize business processes. Experience with test management and automation testing is preferred. Experience selecting and analyzing data using Oracle database tools and SQL language is preferred. Experience that demonstrates outstanding communication skills in both verbal and written form through the use of the MS Office Suite and web conference tools. Physical and Mental Requirements: Ability to sit at a computer monitor for extended periods of time Ability to perform repetitive finger, hand, and arm movements Ability to lift up to 15lbs. Ability to effectively discern information and formulate appropriate action Ability to reach, squat, bend, and manually manipulate standard office equipment Values and Behaviors: Build enduring RELATIONSHIPS with clients and each other. Drive INNOVATION that simplifies life and work. Seek continuous GROWTH in your personal and professional development. Commit with HEART to serve others. Extend TRUST in order to receive it. We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary and comprehensive benefits. The annualized range for this role is $66,000 - $123,000, and the pay rate for the successful applicant depends on a variety of non-discriminatory factors including, but not limited to, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The role may be eligible for performance-based incentive compensation and those details will be provided during the recruitment process. We offer eligible associates cost-effective benefit options including comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, and vision plans), a 401(k)-retirement savings plan with employer match for qualifying associate contributions, an employee assistance program, life insurance, disability insurance, tuition assistance, mental health resources, paid time off for vacation, illness, volunteerism, and holidays. Benefit eligibility begins the first day of the month following the date of hire for associates who are regularly scheduled to work at least thirty hours weekly.
